channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12715] getLastSequenceId always returns -1
item.description:
When addressing HBASE-12405 I found that LastSequenceId.getLastSequenceId always returns -1, then I found that we use encodedRegionName when calling this method. But when we doing regionServerReport, we use regionName to report to HMaster(see the code in HRegionServer.createRegionLoad).

We need to fix this, as seems we will disable distributed log replay in 0.98 by default?

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Seems that HLogKey does not have a getRegionName method...
So should we use encodedRegionName when doing regionServerReport?

And it is hard to write a testcase because we skip edits everywhere. It does not impact correctness, only impacts MTTR.

Instead of using encodedRegionName when doing regionServerReport, can we make use of the following public method of HRegionInfo ?


  public static String encodeRegionName(final byte [] regionName) {

Duo Zhang Please outline the implications (we are using region name comparing in some places but we are using encoded region name otherwise)? Generally, encoded region name – because it is short – should be used especially if a human does not have to read it.

Generally, encoded region name – because it is short – should be used especially if a human does not have to read it.

stack ServerLoad is widely used and there is a reference in table_jsp.java, so I think we should not change it to encodedRegionName since this is displayed to user?
Duo Zhang Was giving you a 'general' rule. A lookup from encoded name to region name in a jsp page shouldn't get in the way of a change that would make our internals more sensible. Thanks Duo Zhang

stack I found that ServerLoad will be returned by the getClusterStatus method. This is opened to user in HBaseAdmin so I think it is dangerous to change its content?

Ted Yu's suggestion is the simplest solution I think, just change flushedSequenceIdByRegion's key from regionName to encodedRegionName but do not change the ServerLoad.
use encodedRegionName when updateLastFlushedSequenceIds

The test finishes in 20 seconds - maybe classify as medium test ?


+    HTable table = testUtil.createTable(tableName, families);

Close the table at the end of the test.


+      for (HRegion r : hrs.getOnlineRegions(tableName)) {

+        region = r;

Do you want to get the last online region or, any online region ? If the latter, you can break out of the loop.

Ping Enis Soztutar for inclusion in 1.0.0 release

Without the fix, the test fails with:


Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 11.458 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestGetLastFlushedSequenceId

test(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestGetLastFlushedSequenceId)  Time elapsed: 10.974 sec  <<< FAILURE!

java.lang.AssertionError: null

	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)

	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)

	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:52)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestGetLastFlushedSequenceId.test(TestGetLastFlushedSequenceId.java:95)

Ping Andrew Purtell for inclusion in 0.98

Duo:
Can you prepare patch for 0.98 branch ?

Thanks

addressing Ted Yu's comments.

patch for 0.98 coming soon

patch for 0.98

And seems 0.98.9 is still in RC? Maybe we can integrate this in the next RC since the change is trivial.
